name: Butrint
description: A UNESCO World Heritage site, Butrint is an ancient city that showcases ruins from the Greek, Roman, and Byzantine eras. Its stunning natural surroundings and rich history make it a must-visit.

name: Ksamil Islands
description: Known for its crystal-clear waters and beautiful beaches, the Ksamil Islands are a perfect spot for relaxation and swimming. The islands offer a picturesque getaway with stunning views.

name: Theth National Park
description: This remote park is famous for its breathtaking landscapes, traditional stone houses, and hiking trails. It's an excellent destination for nature lovers and adventure seekers.

name: Gjirokastër
description: A UNESCO World Heritage site, Gjirokastër is known for its well-preserved Ottoman architecture and the impressive Gjirokastër Castle. The town offers a glimpse into Albania's rich history.

name: Berat
description: Often referred to as the 'City of a Thousand Windows', Berat is known for its stunning Ottoman-era architecture and beautiful hillside location. The castle offers panoramic views of the surrounding area.

name: Blue Eye (Syri i Kaltër)
description: This natural spring features striking blue waters and lush greenery, creating a stunning visual contrast. It's a great spot for hiking and photography.

name: Apollonia
description: An ancient Greek city known for its archaeological remains, Apollonia features ruins such as a theater and a temple. The site provides insight into the ancient history of the region.

name: Vlora Promenade
description: The bustling promenade in Vlora is lined with cafes, restaurants, and shops, making it a perfect place for a leisurely stroll. It offers beautiful views of the Adriatic Sea.

name: Lake Ohrid
description: Lake Ohrid is one of the oldest and deepest lakes in Europe, known for its biodiversity and stunning scenery. It's a great location for swimming, fishing, and enjoying nature.

name: Krujë Castle
description: A historical fortress that played a significant role in Albania's resistance against the Ottoman Empire. The castle offers impressive views and houses a museum dedicated to national hero Skanderbeg.

name: Shkodra Lake
description: This expansive lake offers opportunities for boating, fishing, and birdwatching. The surrounding area is rich in natural beauty and cultural heritage.

name: Dajti Mountain
description: Just outside Tirana, Dajti Mountain is accessible by a cable car and offers stunning views of the city and surrounding landscapes. It's a popular spot for hiking and picnicking.

name: Shetitorja
description: This vibrant waterfront promenade is filled with restaurants, bars, and shops, making it a lively spot for both locals and tourists. It's ideal for evening strolls by the sea.

name: The National History Museum
description: The largest museum in Albania, it showcases the country's rich history from ancient times to the present. The museum's exhibits provide valuable insights into Albanian culture.

name: Blaz
description: A hidden gem in the Kukës region, Blaz is known for its stunning landscapes and traditional villages. It offers a true off-the-beaten-path experience.

name: Llogara National Park
description: This park features breathtaking mountain views, diverse flora and fauna, and stunning coastal scenery. It's perfect for hiking and nature exploration.

name: Përmet
description: Known for its natural hot springs and stunning landscapes, Përmet is a tranquil destination perfect for relaxation and outdoor activities.

name: The Ethnographic Museum
description: Housed in a beautifully preserved Ottoman-era home, the museum offers a glimpse into traditional Albanian life and culture.

name: Koman Lake
description: Famous for its breathtaking fjord-like scenery, Koman Lake is a stunning destination for boat tours and exploration of the surrounding mountains.

name: Saranda Castle
description: Perched above the town, Saranda Castle offers panoramic views of the Ionian Sea and the nearby islands. The ruins are a testament to the area's rich history.

name: The Mosaic of Aleksandër Moisiu
description: This stunning mosaic is a remarkable piece of art located in Durrës, showcasing intricate designs and vibrant colors. It's a symbol of the city's artistic heritage.

name: Bunker Art
description: A unique art installation in a former bunker, Bunker Art combines history with contemporary art. It reflects on Albania's communist past and offers a thought-provoking experience.

name: The Church of St. Mary
description: This historic church is known for its stunning frescoes and beautiful architecture. It offers insight into the region's religious and cultural heritage.

name: The Albanian Riviera
description: The Albanian Riviera boasts stunning beaches, crystal-clear waters, and charming coastal towns. It's perfect for a summer getaway with plenty of sun and sea.

name: Bovilla Lake
description: A beautiful reservoir located just outside of Tirana, Bovilla Lake is a great spot for hiking and enjoying nature. The surrounding mountains add to its stunning beauty.

name: Rrëza i Dajti
description: A lesser-known area near Dajti Mountain, offering peaceful trails and stunning views. It's perfect for those looking to escape the crowds.

name: Përmet's Thermal Springs
description: Famous for its natural thermal springs, Përmet offers a relaxing experience amidst beautiful landscapes. The mineral-rich waters are said to have therapeutic properties.

name: The Ruins of Kalivo
description: Abandoned ruins of an old village located near the sea, Kalivo offers a glimpse into history along with stunning views of the coastline.

name: The Fortress of Bashtovë
description: A historical fortress that dates back to the 14th century, it offers fascinating insights into the medieval history of Albania.

name: The Tomb of Ali Pasha
description: This picturesque site is the resting place of the famous Ottoman leader Ali Pasha. It is set on an island and can be reached by a short boat ride.

name: The Castle of Petrela
description: A historic castle overlooking the landscape near Tirana, known for its impressive architecture and stunning views. It offers a glimpse into Albania's medieval past.

name: Sari Salltiku Mountain
description: A less-traveled mountain offering hiking trails and stunning vistas of the Gjirokastër valley. It's perfect for those seeking adventure and solitude.
